results.title: DeSantis Declares Victory as Disney Is Stripped of Some 56-Year-Old Perks
results.abstract: The Legislature approved a bill that restricts the autonomy of Florida’s largest private employer over a fight involving the teaching of sexual orientation and gender identity.
org_facet: Disney, Walt, World (Lake Buena Vista, Fla)

media.caption: For more than five decades, Disney has effectively been able to self-govern its 25,000-acre theme park complex in Florida.

results.title: Oh, No. Time to Worry About Norovirus Again.
results.abstract: Nausea, vomiting, stomach pain: The illness is contagious (and highly unpleasant).

results.byline: By Mike Baker and Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
results.title: University Investigated Idaho Murder Suspect’s Behavior Around Time of Killings
results.abstract: Bryan Kohberger had a verbal altercation with a professor and was investigated over his behavior around female students before he was charged in four murders.

media.caption: Bryan Kohberger was studying criminology at Washington State University in Pullman, Wash., at the time of the murders.

results.title: U.S. Jet Shoots Down Flying Object Over Canada
results.abstract: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said he and President Biden had ordered the object violating Canadian airspace to be taken down, a day after another object was shot out of the sky near Alaska.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada at an event in January. “I ordered the take down of an unidentified object that violated Canadian airspace,” Mr. Trudeau said in a Twitter post on Saturday.

results.adx_keywords: Airlines and Airplanes;Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Airports;Buses;American Airlines;Federal Aviation Administration;Los Angeles International Airport
results.title: Plane and Bus Collide at Los Angeles Airport, Injuring 5, Officials Say
results.abstract: An American Airlines jet that was not carrying passengers struck a shuttle bus on Friday night in what was the latest in a spate of unusual incidents at major airports.

results.title: Cody Longo, ‘Days of Our Lives’ Actor, Dies at 34
results.abstract: Mr. Longo died in his sleep, likely from accidental alcohol poisoning, at his Austin, Texas, home on Wednesday, his representative said.

media.caption: Cody Longo at the 2018 MTV Video Music Awards in New York City. He died on Wednesday at the age of 34.

results.title: Student Fatally Stabs Another at Minnesota High School, Police Say
results.abstract: The stabbing, which happened at Harding High School in St. Paul on Friday, was the first homicide in the city this year, the police said.

media.caption: Staff members leave Harding High School in St. Paul, Minn., after a student was fatally stabbed on Friday.
media.copyright: Aaron Lavinsky/Star Tribune, via Associated Press

results.abstract: The first-term Democrat from Pennsylvania was admitted to a Washington hospital after feeling lightheaded.

media.caption: Senator John Fetterman entering the House chamber before the State of the Union address on Tuesday.

results.title: I Love You, but I Don’t Want to Sleep With You
results.abstract: Snoring and conflicting schedules are top reasons couples decide to sleep in separate bedrooms. Sex therapists and marriage counselors have their doubts about the arrangement.

media.caption: Cara and Rich Newhart began sleeping apart at the beginning of the pandemic and stuck with the arrangement when they bought a new house in New Jersey.

results.title: Warning Issued for Baby Trend Stroller After Death
results.abstract: Another baby was injured, leading the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission to warn about the risks of children getting trapped in the stroller’s front canopy if it isn’t properly used.

media.caption: Officials are urging consumers to properly store the Sit N’ Stand Double and Ultra strollers with model numbers beginning with “SS76” or “SS66.”

results.title: The Most Empty Downtown in America

results.title: Metal Detector Hobbyist Finds a 500-Year-Old Pendant Linked to Henry VIII
results.abstract: Researchers say the jewelry, found in a field outside Birmingham, England, is an extraordinary piece of treasure.

media.caption: The gold, heart-shaped pendant has symbols connected to Henry VIII and his first wife, Katherine of Aragon.

results.title: Boy, 12, Is Fatally Shot by Owner of Stolen Car in Denver, Police Say
results.abstract: The boy was in the car when the vehicle’s owner found it using an app and “exchanged fire” with the people inside, the police said.

media.caption: Elias Armstrong, 12, died at Denver Health Medical Center after being shot by the owner of a stolen vehicle, the authorities said.

results.title: New York State to Drop Requirement That Masks Be Worn in Hospitals
results.abstract: Starting Sunday, health care facilities like hospitals and nursing homes will be able to set their own rules for when masks are necessary.

media.caption: New York State health officials said masks would no longer be required in health settings as of Feb. 12.
media.copyright: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Stroke;Content Type: Personal Profile;United States Politics and Government;Fetterman, John (1969- );Senate;Democratic Party;Pennsylvania
results.title: Fetterman, Recovering After Stroke, Labors to Adjust to Life in the Senate
results.abstract: The first-term Democrat, who was released Friday after two days in the hospital, is coping with the lasting effects of a near-fatal stroke last year, and Congress is adapting to accommodate him.

media.caption: Senator John Fetterman, Democrat of Pennsylvania, won one of the most competitive Senate races last year after suffering a near-fatal stroke.
media.copyright: T.J. Kirkpatrick for The New York Times

results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Maria Abi-Habib
results.title: Corruption Trial of Mexican Ex-Lawman Ripples Beyond Courtroom
results.abstract: As prosecutors close their case against Genaro García Luna, the eventual verdict will be felt by Mexican officials and among U.S. agents who work there.

media.caption: Genaro Garciá Luna, who once served as the public face of Mexico’s war on drugs, is accused of taking millions in bribes from the very cartels he was supposed to be pursuing.

results.title: I.R.S. Tells Millions Who Received State Rebates: Don’t File Just Yet
results.abstract: Tax season is underway. But the Internal Revenue Service is still figuring out whether taxpayers who received rebates last year should count them as taxable income.

media.caption: The Internal Revenue Service is determining which special payments that states made to residents last year should be taxed.
media.copyright: Stefani Reynolds for The New York Times

results.title: My Roommate Won’t Pay Rent and Won’t Leave. What Can I Do?
